pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing suspension
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:0.4: 5. The training rule on receiving food
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:1.2: At that time there was a beautiful nun called Sundarīnandā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:1.3: When people saw her in the dining hall, they gave her the best food, both the donors and the recipient having lust.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:1.4: Sundarīnandā ate as much as she liked,
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:1.5: but not so the other nuns.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:1.6: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:1.7: “How could Venerable Sundarīnandā, being lustful, eat either fresh or cooked food after receiving it directly from a lustful man?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:1.8: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Sundarīnandā did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:1.11: “How could Sundarīnandā, being lustful, eat either fresh or cooked food after receiving it directly from a lustful man?
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:1.13: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:1.14.1: ‘If a lustful nun eats fresh or cooked food after receiving it directly from a lustful man, then that nun too has committed an immediate offense entailing sending away and suspension.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.1.6: having lust, longing for, in love with.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.1.8: having lust, longing for, in love with.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.1.10: a human male, not a male spirit, not a male ghost, not a male animal. He understands and is capable of having lust.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.1.12: apart from the five cooked foods, water, and tooth cleaners, the rest is called “fresh food”.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.1.14: there are five kinds of cooked food: cooked grain, porridge, flour products, fish, and meat.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.1.15: If she receives fresh or cooked food with the intention of eating it, she commits a serious offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.1.16: For every mouthful, she commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.1.18: this is said with reference to the preceding offenses.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.1.20: there is an offense as soon as the misconduct is committed, and no pressing is required.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.1.22: she is sent away from the Sangha.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.1.24: … Therefore, too, it is called an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.2.1: If she receives water or a tooth cleaner, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.2.2: If only the man has lust, and she receives fresh or cooked food with the intention of eating it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.2.3: For every mouthful, she commits a serious offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.2.4: If she receives water or a tooth cleaner, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.2.5: If both of them have lust, and she receives fresh or cooked food with the intention of eating it directly from a male spirit, a male ghost, a _paṇḍaka_, or a male animal in human form, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.2.6: For every mouthful, she commits a serious offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.2.7: If she receives water or a tooth cleaner, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.2.8: If only the male being has lust, and she receives fresh or cooked food with the intention of eating it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.2.9: For every mouthful, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.2.10: If she receives water or a tooth cleaner, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.3.3: if she receives, knowing that the man has no lust;
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.3.5: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.3.6: The fifth offense entailing suspension is finished.
